title.narrative: Somalia JR 2 2020

description.narrative: Somalia remains on the edge of a humanitarian catastrophe. Continuing drought from 2016/17 means very little recovery and resilience for millions of Somalis who have lost their livestock and access to adequate food and water sources. Erratic rains and abnormally hot and dry conditions in the first half of 2019 further exacerbated the drought crisis, with about 6.3 million Somalis – about 42% of the entire population – requiring humanitarian assistance – i.e. expected to be acutely food insecure through December 2019. 2.1 million of these are projected to face severe acute food insecurity conditions (IPC 3+), a 40% increase from January this year. , An estimated one million children under the age of five are likely to be acutely malnourished through mid-2020 and 2.6 million people remain displaced. Given the needs and expertise of the members, the SOMJR 2020 will continue to implement in the same sectors as the SOMJR 2019. These include FSL, WASH, Health, Nutrition, Protection and Multi-Purpose Cash.

description.narrative: FSC-R2 activity 1: Provide 350 families in Qalax IDP with unconditional food assitance using the voucher system for 4 months.

Conditional and unrestricted cash
Number of people benefitting from conditional and unrestricted cash

description.narrative: CSH-R2 Activity 1: Cash for work for 250 HHs from lughaya for salt production for 3 months CSH-R2 Activity 1: Cash for work for 150 HH (soil bands)

title.narrative: Participation
Number of crisis-affected people who are also involved in the design, implementation, montoring and/or evaluation of the programme

description.narrative: During the project design, village heads, government authorities, children, NGO actors will be directly involved and consulted. During the implementation, monitoring and evaluation representatives from the beneficiaries will be involved and community committees will be setup. Community committees and local authorities will be part of the selection, verification and registration of beneficiaries.

title.narrative: Capacity Building (reach)
Number of national and local actors supported with capacity-building

description.narrative: LOC-R3 Activity 1: Establish and functionalize 1 CBO in Malawle IDP. LOC-R3 Activity 2: Strengthening the 2 existing CBOs in Nasahablod A and Nasahablod B IDPs (Hargeisa).

title.narrative: Prevention and response to violence
Number of persons who receive an appropriate response

description.narrative: PRO-I6 activity 1: Set up a referral system for GBV and (child) protection services and support 60 GBV and Child Protection cases to access appropriate Protection services including Psycho social support, legal aid and health/medical services(Mandheera, Qalax and Malawle IDPs)

title.narrative: Capacity building (Protection)
Number of participants showing an increased knowledge on the protection subject in focus

description.narrative: PRO-R6 Activity 1: Establish/strengthen 6 protection committees in Naasahablood A&B, Mandheera A&B, Qalax and Malawle IDPs. PRO-R6 Activity 2: Organize trainings on child rights, protection, case management and GBV for the protection committees PRO-R6 Activity 3: Organize trainings and awareness raising sessions on child rights, protection, case management and GBV (456 individuals Malowle + 1200 individuals Madheera + 350 indiv. Qalax). each household one person will be trained.

title.narrative: Hygiene promotion
Number of people having regular access to soap to meet hygienic needs

description.narrative: WSH-R1: Provide hygiene kits (Laundry Saup, bath saup, detergent powder) to (250 families living in Malawle IDP, Hargeisa and 350 families in Qalax IDP, Hargeisa).

title.narrative: Excreta disposal
Number of people having access to dignified, safe, clean and functional excreta disposal facilities

description.narrative: WSH-R2 Acitivty 1: Construct 70 communal dry lartines shared by 3 families each in Malawle IDP (Hargeisa).

title.narrative: Water supply
Number of people having access to sufficient and safe water for domestic use

description.narrative: WSH-R4 activity 1: Distribute jerri-cans and aqua tabs for (350 families Qalax IDP Hargeisa and 250 HH malawle IDP Hargeisa

title.narrative: Solid waste management
Number of people living in settlements with a functional solid waste management system

description.narrative: WSH-R5 activity 1: Establish/Strengthen WASH committees in 5 targeted IDPs (Mandheera A&B, Naasahablood A&B and Malawle,). WSH-R5 activity2: Establish 4 garbage dumbing pits in Malawle, Qalax and Madheera A$B IDPs. WSH-R5 activity 3:Provide cleaning tools (wheelbarrows, rake, shovel, masks and hand gloves) to WASH Committees in Mandheera, Naasahablood A&B and Malawle IDPs.

title.narrative: Hygiene promotion (Awareness)
Number of people reached with hygiene promotion/awareness raising activities

description.narrative: WSH-R6 activity 1: Organize hygiene, sanitation and nutrition focused awareness raising sessions and campaigns in Malawle IDP Hargeisa.

title.narrative: Prevention and response to COVID-19 pandemic related to WASH
Number of people receiving COVID-19 related assistance (WASH).

description.narrative: "1. Awareness raising for communities within the selected 5 IDP's on Covid 19 2. Awanress and Orentation sessions for health centers/MCH on Hygine and Covid 19 3. Hygeine kits for households within selected IDP ( Laundry Soap, Bath Soap, detergent powder, Jerricans, bucket, and aqua tabs) 4. Hygine kits for MCH and other Health (Hand Wash/Liquid soap, Powder, soap, etc, cleaning materials for bathroom, and MCH (Clorux, brooms, liquids). 7. Provision of PPE Materails for staff"
